reviewText:
This game is an excellent representation of how to become a full fledged developer on Steam.

First, lets buy a Unity asset pack. Put in about......oh.. about 15 mins worth of work? And shovel it onto Steam.

Now, as they have done, please make sure you attach Steam Trading Cards to it. That way, people will still buy it for the cards. Classic.

Now, you can take some notes from these developers. They release updates" every 2 to 3 months. Why is this important? Well
recommended: because now it looks like you are actually committed to change and improving your stolen work. Make sure you attach some cool version numbers like 1.2
hoursPlayed: or 1.5. Extra points if you drag it out to 3 numbers like they have done. Dont worry if the few people who actually play your game complain that your updates did absolutely nothing
voteText: and call you a scammer. No one will read them or care. Trust me

reviewText:
tl;dr: Under any circumstances you can't play this game properly. The loss in time isn't worth the profit you get from the cards. (Please proceed to the summary.)


GameplayYou can select from 5 different blocky characters which start with different items (following typos are ingame):
Policeman: Spawn with gun and ammunitions
Farmer: Have an awesom and piece of woods
Salaryman: Spawn with food and several items
Noo New: She have everything necessary
Doctor: Have a medicines and survival kit
The game offers 3 different maps (typos in the titles are ingame):
Zombie Land - open world survivor
- You are set in an open but limited world, can retrieve items and you have to kill zombies.
Sandbox - just for test
- Here you can try out the game, guns and what not. Unluckily you can't test the crafting system as there are no ressources to find.
Death Match - plyers vs players
- Obviously a map for pvp action.
You will have a health, hunger and thirst bar.
Health drops on damage.
Hunger decreases over time.
Thirst decreases over time too but quicker.
In general you have to live from pickups.

You run around, find pickups and kill blocky zombies. There are only 2 types of them: Normal ones and (let's call them) raging ones. Latter run faster.
If you die you lose everything you collected and respawn. You aren't able to pick up items where you died.

At the start you may have a gun with limited ammo. You need to find new guns and bullets from pickups.

You can find wood and metal plates to craft different things, also found as pickups. You can craft rudimentary building parts too. With rudimentary I mean about 5 different parts. Foundation, wall, roof, door, window if I remember correctly.

I'm sorry but I have nothing positive to say about this game.

Issues that really need to be fixed:Most guns shoot multiple or all bullets at once without inflicting any damage or damage equal to one bullet. (The update stating Fixed shooting" is false!)
Remapping key bindings is missing
date: the pop-up menu before starting the game doesn't work either and is missing options like reload or sprint.\nThere is no way to set mouse sensitivity ingame. I could change my mouses' dpi but then it would take ages to drag the cursor in the menues.\nScrolling takes ages
recommended: it would be better if one step on the scroll wheel would be equal to one row in the menu. At current state you have to do multiple laps with your mouse wheel per row. The wheel is more convenient than dragging the scroll bar in the heat of the battle.\nTalking about battle: There needs to be a quicker way to swap weapons
hoursPlayed: for example switching guns by directly using the mouse wheel. At the moment you need to open the item list by pressing [E]
voteText: (maybe you even need to click & drag the scroll bar)
helpfulPercent: select a weapon by clicking on it
votesHelpful: click on "Use"
votesTotal: click [E] again to close the menu. Congratulations
votesFunny: you are dead.\nMany other flaws
commentsCount: (this list isn't complete):Broken English.\nThe game doesn't tell you all the controls. For example sprint [SHIFT]
column16: reload [R]
column17: items menu [E]. These 3 you have to figure out yourself.\nZombies pop up randomly in your proximity
column18: sometimes even a few steps in front of you. Yes
column19:
you occasionally watch them spawn and drop on the floor and then running at you.
Zombies that are stuck in the floor. You can only see their heads sticking out of the soil. They run at you but can't damage you. You can't damage them either.
Items spawning in front of your nose.
Floating props
column20:
items and buildings. (The update stating "Houses do not float in the air" is false!)
Glitches and inconsistencies in graphics. Sometimes you can see cracks in the floor. Your gun has a shadow but your character model hasn't any.
This game has no music at all and you can't change the sound volume.
The pause menu (called "Main Menu") only has the options "Resume" and "Disconnect". (Yes
column21: even in single player mode it is called "Disconnect".)\nMultiplayer spawn camping is easier than in any other game I played. No secured area to spawn
column23: spawn points basically next to each other. Position yourself at the side of the spawn points
column24: just wait for spawning enemies and shoot.\nIn multiplayer everyone can join the same team
column25:
there is no automated or manual way to balance teams. In addition every time you die you can swap teams.
Most multiplayer games are not reachable. The seventh game I tried to join finally worked. After I looked for another one I had to check even more games.
If you open the chat prompt you can't close it other than writing a message. So if you hit [ENTER] by accident you have to send something.
Last but not least this game impersonates dishonesty!This game is simply a 1:1 ripoff of this asset package called UnitZ[assetstore.unity3d.com].
If you look close enough even the description is a partial copy.
Originally posted by Steam store description:Sandbox
column27: open world game in a few steps. The game also with several different gameplay modes such as Death Match
column29: and Zombie Swarm. You can create your world
column31: and enjoy the games with your friends.Originally posted by Asset store description:This kit can help you to create a sandbox
column33: open world game in a few steps. The pack also comes with several different gameplay modes such as Death Match
column35: and Zombie Swarm. You can create your world
column37:
and enjoy the games with your friends.Sidenote: The game "developer" even forgot to delete "in a few steps" in his stolen description.

Also take a look at the videos and screenshots on both places. You will see that everything is the same except the name.

Assets from the assetstore are mostly meant to be a base or a nice addition to your own game. In this case UnitZ is meant as foundation and you build your game around it and fix possible issues.

I don't know if the added halloween props are copied/stolen too. It looks like they aren't part of the UnitZ assets. (But maybe from another one).


SummaryHere we have an unplayble game as it is broken to a point that you simply won't be able to play it properly. On top of that Uncrowded is a fraud because it is a blatant one-to-one copy in almost every single bit.
Shame on the developer Kotach.

Catastrophic game
Don't buy and support this game by any means. (Except you are greedy and want to make profit from cards if it is on a 2 cents discount again.)

I never thought I would ever need to give this rating to any game:
0/10"

reviewText:
This thing is buggy as hell.

If you hit a zombie with an axe they basically fly towards the horizon.
When you get in the one car on the main survival map, it goes slower than when you're running, when the zombies catch up with you and hit the car, the car goes hurtling through the air.
When the car gets flipped upside down, you see under the map, when you get out you're launched flying into the air like some kind of square headed rocket.
If you want to endure this ordeal with a friend and they pick up an item, you hear the sound of picking things up through your own system, even if they're on the other side of the map.

Update 1.0.1 suggests that houses do NOT float in the air (If you have this problem when your game is released, your game is not even close to public release, Beta or not). There's also one that still floats majestically above the map, I can't say where the house is because you're given no ideas for direction in the form of a map or even a compass.

We made a video on Uncrowded recently which showcases all these problems if you'd like to see them without paying the Â£1.59 to buy the game.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TSDwyHi3_n4

reviewText:
Now, before I say a game is sh*t, I usually give the game at least 1 hour of game time before I judge.
I'm sorry, but I can't do that with this game.

I literally cannot stand playing this game without wanting to vomit. It's such a blatant copy & paste of Unturned & a blatant copy & paste of a Unity Assets Store game[www.assetstore.unity3d.com] that I really feel bad for the creators of those products.

I also feel bad for the Greenlight developers who genuinely try to make their games good & put actual effort in it. This game is so laughably lazy that it makes me wonder how the hell did it even get on to Steam in the first place.

I admit that I don't have a great PC right now, in fact - it's pretty much a toaster without the toasting part, but I've tried playing games like Unturned, Half-Life 2 & Team Fortress 2 on this thing - they all get at least 20-30 FPS, Unturned being a 60 FPS 100% of the time. This game? How does playing at 10 FPS constantly sound? Good? No.

The gameplay is...r*tarded. You have enemies that insta-kill you without trying, while you get a gun" that is so laughably bad
date:
you'd be better off hitting said enemies with a feather.

Don't get lured in by the pathetically cheap $0.02 price tag. Save your money & go buy a balloon instead. You'll have more fun with that.

If you REALLY want a sandbox game that is much better than this - play Unturned. It's also free

reviewText:
Let's get this out of the way, Uncrowded is an asset flip plain and simple...it's the UnitZ Unity asset package copypasted and resold on Steam.

Refer to this video by Jim Sterling to see this sad new trend flooding the Steam market.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1m6XTfn34Bw

PROS:

-basically none

CONS:

-graphics are unremarkable, the UnitZ asset isn't bad but looks too plain and there's several issues with textures and shadows continuosly flickering as you move: houses and farms are often just big empty boxes with no furniture, there's an handful of player and zombie models with little to no variation

-your arms have only one animation, it's the same swing whether you're using a melee weapon, eating or healing yourself

-horrible and bare sounds, the weirdly remixed brains" that zombies repeat over and over is especially annoying
date:
firearms sound is also often bugged

-terrible UI

-zombie AI is basically non-existent
recommended: they often get stuck on things or wander aimlessly due to their bad pathfinding\n\n-no gathering
hoursPlayed: you find loot and materials just lying around for no reason: said loot also often just floats above the floor\n\n-barebones crafting

sometimes it'll fire 3 bullets in a row or none at all

-clipping issues all over the place

reviewText:
First off, I'd like to state that this game is amazing. I only gave it a thumbs down because I'm trying to be innovative, like the developer.
You see, Uncrowded isn't just a game. It's a way of life. For instance, the guns in this game don't do any damage, unless your gun is literally inside the zombie's face. The dev himself is an absolute genius for doing this, and only the most cultured individuals would understand.
Mahatma Gandhi himself would have advocated for this. It's a testament to how we shouldn't solve our problems with guns, and how we need to find other ways of solving problems.
Do you know any other game that has CTRL hotkeyed to shoot? Do you know any other game that lets you punch zombies through walls? Any other game where your fists are more effective than a shotgun?
Of course you don't, because those games aren't Uncrowded. Some crappier games have attempted to copy the splendor of Uncrowded, but all have failed. I'm looking at you, Unturned. Sure Unturned has cars. but Uncrowded has something else. It has soul, dedication... HEART. Unturned doesn't charge you to play, and is a f2p" game
date: but Uncrowded does. This is because the dev himself knew that microtransactions aren't a good business model. Just look at Payday2.\nNot to mention

reviewText:
This game is the best thing I have played in years. It was worth every penny of the $0.19 that I gave up to play this. So here's a rundown of all the features that make this game a canidate for Game of the year 2015.

1. Combat: Never before have I ever played a game with a combat mechanic as unique as this. Whenever you click to fire a gun, you expect it to fire one bullet, but not in Uncrowded. Nope, Uncrowded has gone the extra mile by making it so whenever you fire a gun, it unloads the entire ammo clip in one earsplitting volley (Note: firing seven bullets at once does not deal the damage of 7 bullets, in fact, 9/11 times all the bullets will miss). Also, never before in any game has a more shoddy Melee mechanic been developed. The range for all weapons is concistent, meaning that, whether you're armed with a flashlight or a fireaxe, you're going to run up to a zombie and take 10 damage if you want to kill the zombie. Also, the damage recieved by player characters and npcs from melee weapons is not consistent, i.e. you're able to one hit a player with a flashlight, but with a fireaxe, it takes 2 -3 hits to kill a player. Meanwhile zombies will take 2 - 3 hits with a flashlight and only 1 with the fireaxe (Update: June 29th 8:43 p.m. After more experiments, the flashlight is offically the most op weapon. It can down ANYTHING in 1 hit at a cost of 10 -20 damage). Turely a combat mechanic as amazing and aweinspiring as this has never been seen before.

2. Game sounds: Most people would consider it a bug when the sound of another person (in multiplayer) picking up items is broadcast to everyone on the server no matter where they are, but it's just another one of those charming features that makes Uncrowded so irrisitable. There is literally no doplar effect in the game, meaning that zombies will make the same amount of noise whether they are 40 yards away from you, or right behind you. This often leads to countless â™¥â™¥â™¥ rapings since you never know whether or not a zombie is behind you. (Note: an easy fix to this is to just spin in circles for the entire game).

3. Special" Zombies: Uncrowded has three very special and unique types of zombies. First
date: there are the regular zombies which will start gaily jumping towards the player out of sheer excitement of finally finding a potential target to â™¥â™¥â™¥ rape. Second
recommended: are the magical Big Black Satan zombies that dwell deep in the woods. These zombies almost always spawn next to the "re spawn" points
hoursPlayed: which means after you "re spawn" you're going to get â™¥â™¥â™¥ raped again. They deal a ludicrous amount of damage and there seems to be no spawn cap
voteText: which means three of these over grown â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥s are going to be somewhere on the map
helpfulPercent: ready to pounce upon the player's virgin booty. Third are the super amazing teleporting zombies. If you want to keep you're player safe by camping out on a roof top
votesHelpful: it's certain that one of these will spawn directly behind the player. The player will then be â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ in the â™¥â™¥â™¥ and die.\n\n4. Day and Night cycles: Because if getting â™¥â™¥â™¥ raped in the day wasn't fun enough
votesTotal: getting â™¥â™¥â™¥ raped in the night (slightly darker day) is twice the fun.\n\n5. Cars: Actually
votesFunny: there's only one car which can go about 0.4 miles an hour
commentsCount: when it's not gliching out or getting stuck on the road. However
column16: the car is the most op weapon since it is the only thing that will one hit a zombie
column17: provided there is only one directly infront of the hood. If there is more than one zombie
column18: the car will flip over and you will die. The car also does jackshit when it comes to protecting the player from zombies
column19: since they can easily jump ontop of the car and proceed to hug and â™¥â™¥â™¥ rape the player to death. (Update: June 29th
column20: 8:42 p.m. if the pc enters the car after it rolls over
column22: the pc will be catapulted about 50 feet in the air and die on impact with the ground)\n\n6. The name: The game is way more crowded than the title suggest. The town
column24: and farms are constantly patrolled by the 3rd Zombie Platoon: Silent â™¥â™¥â™¥ Raping Division.\n\n7. Construction: Apparently it's possible to erect a dwelling of your very own
column25: but you're mostlikely going to get â™¥â™¥â™¥ raped by the silent zombies before you can gather enough materials.\n\n8. Realistic need bars: Your pc will get hunrgy and thirsty
column26:
which can be solved by selecting any food or drink item in the inventory and literally throwing the food in your face.

9. Sprint mechanic: Your character can sprint forever.

Clearly
column27: this game is amazing. It has almost every feature a person could want
column30: and keating. It's obviouly better than any other game that has been or ever will be released. Instead of paying $69.69 for Fallout 4

column36: not a game. Uncrowded is an experience for an individual. Uncrowded is an â™¥â™¥â™¥ raping simulator. Uncrowded is a software that can be downloaded onto the hard drive of your very own personal computer and executed via a desktop shortcut then played for countless hours with friends and/or by your self. reviewText:
This game is absolute dogsh!t. It is a ripoff from other ripoff games.

The mouse lag in this game is horrible and the sensitivity cannot be customized. It is unbearable to move the mouse throughout the game and hard to aim at enemies.

The hit detection is broken as bullets just fly through enemies most of the time. Also, the third alternative fire, I believe, literally fires a fury of bullets no matter the weapon, be it pump action shotguns and even the sniper rifle.

Zombie spawns are fairly broken as some of them tend to spawn within houses and get stuck. One of the zombies, a black" zombie

reviewerDisplayName: P I X E L âœ¨
reviewText:
â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬

I don't easily give a game a bad review. But man. This..?
I can't even say anything positive about this.

â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬

The game is completely and utterly BROKEN. I tried joining and restarting the game several times, however, this didn't keep my character from walking on his own :-)

Furthermore, even without this handicap, this game is UNPLAYABLE. I saw multiple bugs and glitches. Such as zombies not taking damage / Being able to eat food multiple times / Zombies turning into trees / Zombies walking into the corner of a room, then suddenly dying out of nowhere, I can go on, but don't feel like even wasting the time.

When I died and waited a few minutes to respawn, the game crashed and gave me a crash report, telling me it would be great if I sent that to the developer of the game. I have better advice for the developer of this game: STOP.

â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬

In conclusion I deeply REGRET paying 2 cents for this, and paying another 2 cents to gift it to a friend as well. Buying a Steam emoticon would have been much more rewarding.

Don't buy this game.

[NOTE: If anything, this game is good for earning your money back by selling the cards it drops for more than you paid for the game, hooray.]

reviewText:
This game is complete trash

I bought this for 19 cents to see that maybe it would be bad, but not completely awful
i was wrong, play the game for 20 minutes and you will stop and request for a refund

Pros
- It looks ok
- Controls are good
- Cards

Cons
- The gun only works when you want to
- Killing a zombie makes it fly up in the air, kinda like waving around a ragdoll in garry's mod with a gravity gun
- When you die, it will respawn you next to more zombies forcing you to die again
- You can't shoot zombies while getting hit
- Finding supplies is hard
- Any building you find will have at least 2 zombies around it
- Zombies pop up out of the ground with no warning

Just get Unturned, it's free and more polished

0.1/5
It's not like Skyrim

recommended: around 500 meg. This developer thinks of everything\nI start the game up. Walk towards a house

reviewText:
This game should be taken off Steam. It is atrocious and you can keep a much better game, for free. It is not even worth Â£0.07, even if you are just playing it for a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ take. I did do this, and bought extra copies for friends. What we got was not even funny.

I'm known for buying bad games, but this is the limit.

Watch a video of this for 30 seconds, and you'll realise that it's only bareable for that amount of time. Even better, the assets used in this peice of garbo aren't even the creator's own, it's from some other people. You will taken to their website if you access a computer ingame, it does this by launching your browser and directing you straight to it, and even better, if you are on the multiplayer mode, it will launch it for all the other players too.

There are 3 gamemodes present. I played one, the zombie one. Better known as the Budget Unturned, with minimal to no features, and this game costs money, which Unturned doesn't.

This game is not finished for sure, GET IT OFF STEAM! This piece of garbo is just an example Steam should at least have quality control, because otherwise, this wouldn't be on Steam. I know that we want to vote for what gets on the Steam store, but it's just not working.

final rating:
mega compacted garbo

reviewText:
This game is just a copy of a low settings Unturned.
Just like one of these cheap games that you only buy to make the games badge.
Very bad driving, breathing, shooting, and camera system.
There are no instructions, there is no multiplayer yet, it's just an alpha.
One shot from a pistol it's just 12 bullets,the firerate is horrible, when I look at the no-wind-moving grass it is moving but when I move it stops and starts moving again.
The camera is pretty bad.
There are no instructions, the vehicle can fly a bit or it's just the bad camera.
Bad eating system.
Zombies coming out of nowhere.
Just a very low graphics Unturned V2.
Well this ''V2'' sucks.
There is no third person view, no cheats, no multiplayer.
It's just a buy-games-for-the-games-badge-.
No hate or anything.
But the game sucks.

reviewText:
The best asset flip on steam.

Almost of of this game's incredibly flawed programing comes from a unity asset pack known as Unit Z. Unit Z was meant to be heavily expanded on, of which this does not. This does not mean this game isn't so bad it's good, however. 1 shot flashlights, water bottons, and 7000 damage ragdoll grenades  are somewhat fun.

PROS:
-So bad it's good
-House building is kinda fun
-multiple player classes

CONS:
-completely unbalanced
-easy-to-grief multiplayer, complete with a lack of ways to hide or lock a base.
-UnitZ

I would give this a 1.5/10. Physically, its a good laugh. Morally, it's shady business practices are awful, and stealing someone's work, even if you bought it, is not OK. (to be fair, its ok to use a few things, just not too many, your game should have a 10:1 ratio of new things to bought things at the very least.)

reviewText:
Uncrowded is not an actual self-made game, it's just another copy-paste of Unity Assets ..
The Good:+absolutely nothing.
The Bad:-it's buggy as  hell (the original asset is working just fine .. but the developer â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ed it somehow ^^)
-Houses and farms are often just big empty boxes, zombies spawn randomly in front of you, there is no way to fast switch your weapons (you need to open your inventory, scroll down then click the item you want, click on use, close the inventory, umm .. probably you're dead by now, never mind ..)
-when you die you lose all of your items & you can't pick em up again.
-lack of craftable items (most of them are useless), lack of content, nothing original ..
-horrible combat system, broken guns (guns fire all the bullets at once without inflicting any damage), terrible animation & much more â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥, i will just stop here.
NO, JUST NO!! 1.5/10

reviewText:
This game will take you from your vintage lounge in your Mom's Basement and place you in the boots of video games most legendary hero, Police cop.

Take a deep and meaningful, and emotional journey through the world of Uncrowded as you hunt down the evil zombies for some reason that I'm not completely sure about.

This game includes dynamic combat, 3D graphics and a beautiful soundtrack. The combat is extremely realistic but with a nice old school feel added to make the game strike home.

I definitely recommend playing this if you are a fan of video games.

inventory system is laggy
menu system is laggy
it's impossible to get to the same server with friends, the IP has to be manually searched from the list (there are no filters) and the servers don't even have names that make sense.

I don't see why anyone would buy this for as much as 99 cents (euro 1) but for the two cents I paid for it, I sure got some good laughs for a few minutes. As a game to play regularly, I won't recommend it but for 5 minutes of â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ and giggles it its totally worth the money.

reviewText:
As many before me have already said in the comments, this product is a copy paste of what someone else already coded.

As is, the game is very poorly made (it does not play as well as in the gam e fottage on the store page) your rounds constantly go through zombies and many times the guns fire 5-12 shots in a single burst with all of them missing the zombies.

The zombies nearly instantly re-spawn as soon as they are killed making it useless to try and kill them.

Even for the $2 price tag i would say this is too much for the game.

TL-DR
-stolen from another development team
-rarely can you shoot zombies as bullets do not seem to render
-no point in crafting system as zombies chase you down anywhere you are before you can use it
-no point in killing zombies because they instantly re-spawn

But hey who am i to talk? if you want to drop $2 and sponsor theft maybe you should pay to get this game....or pay to your local drug lord....either way.

reviewText:
I only got this game because my friends wanted to goof around and it was 2 cents. Instead of sharing my other two-cents, Im just going to try to cleanse my agony and share some of my favorite moments.


My friend joined my server and made me respawn in mid air somewhere across the map.

I jumped onto a bale of hay, died, and hardcore ragdolled.

I saw a zombie trip and die.

I shot all my pistol ammo in 0.4 seconds and didnt do any damage to the zombie.

My friend informed me to drop my gun and use my fists instead.
Punching zombies sends them flying.

Pickups spawn a new pickup once you pick one up.

I picked up a set of fabric in a house, causing another one to spawn on me, instantly killing me.

I punched a zombie and it flew 40 feet away. Then another zombie tripped over its corpse and died.

I decided to make a house. I put a ladder against a wall and build a roof on the other side of the wall.

By this point I decided to hold a competition with my friend of who could collect the most junk in our chest before we were done.

I figured I would try to build my house higher, so I build more walls ontop of my roofs and roofs on the walls, trying to stack my house to the top of the map.

After 3 levels my roofs wouldnt place anymore due to either height limitations, prop limitations, or server stress or something.

My friend got into an overturned car, and upon getting out launched into the air and died.


Worth the 2 cents, not worth the space in my steam library.

reviewText:
I was going to provide a pros and cons list, but I can't find any pros to this game... The little too it that is good is not even originally made by the developer. Most if not all of the game is an asset pack on the Unity store for $50.

Pros:

Trading cards

Cons:

The graphics are too simply made and some of the items don't like what they're supposed to be.

If you hold your left mouse button for any longer than a microsecond, your entire clip instantly empties itself harmlessly.

There are very few items in the game.

The zombies are far too fast to have any chance of surviving for longer than a few minutes.

Overall, the only reason to buy this game is if it's really cheap and you can make a few cents off the cards.

reviewText:
Do I even have to say something about this?! It was 2 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing cents on the sale! I got 18 copies of it so I can have some edgy bragging rights.
The game is downright broken. Nothing works. Cars can't go reverse! We live in a world of chaos!
All the hours I placed into the game are from experimenting around. As you can see from the video on my profile, cars are pretty unsafe. You are safer on foot. Or are you? I died while climbing a ladder, jumping on a car, getting stuck in a door.. The list is never-ending!
Not even the zombies work. They have no hitboxes for firearms so you can only use melee weapons. I recommend the hammer because it sends them flying around. The damage they deal is insane. Zombie lifts his arms, doesn't even hit me, takes away 30 HP. The fast zombies are even worse taking away 50, sometimes 60 HP.
The firearms are a joke. You ever seen a shotgun fire 7 shells at once? You ever saw an AK empty 30 bullets in a second? Then come play this piece of art!
Don't get me wrong. The game is utter â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥. I do have to admit that it is a great deal for lovers of broken games. It kept me laughing for 30 minutes till I started losing breath and almost fainted. I'm glad I bought this game and that it even exists on Steam. Grab a drink and a buddy and enjoy this amazing GOTY!
I got 18 of it so you can add me or message me if you want one to experience the horror
yourself. I rate it a 3.5/10. Needs more crafting!

reviewText:
2Â¢ Review

Game Name:	Uncowded					 Original Release: 	11 May 2015				  My Overall Grade (#/10):Â  	3			  Demo:  	No						  Workshop:  	No					  Level Editor:  	No					  Captions:  	No					  Controller Support: 	Partial				  Multiplayer:Â  	Yes Full					  VR Support:Â  		No				  Steam Cards  / Achieves:  	Yes / No			  VAC:  		No					  Genre:  	Zombie - Sandbox						  Manual:  		No					  Metacritic Score:		N/A			  Full Audio Multi Language:  	No			  Win 10 / Crapple / Linux:  	Yes / Yes / Yes			  Recommended To:Â  	Nobody				  Other:Â  	Pre-Early Release Game that has been released on steam.
5Â¢ Review Pro:
Multi-OS
Full â€“ Multiplayer (single, multi & co-op)
Cards
Great concept

Con:
This game is not finished.  In my opinion it's only just started and somewhere between alpha and very very early beta.

Overall:
5/10 +1 price, +1 full multiplayer -2 alpha / not done (and probably won't ever be) -2 UnitZ / Unity prebuild = 3/10

The Dev is still slowly working on the game but to be fair there is probably 3-4 years to go before this game is worth spending a huge amount of time on. That's the problem with a small dev team.

Now the game is $1, and on sale now and then, and it has cards.  So call it $0.70 after cards.  Can you get $0.70 worth of fun out of this game? Yep. Are you going to get $10 worth of fun? Not unless the dev puts another 3-4 years (20hrs per week) into the game.

There are better free games on steam, there are better similarly priced games on steam, there are just better games (period).  There are two reasons to get this game. First if it's on sale for less than the cards cost.  Second, you have 3 buddies and want to have some â€œthis game sucks so bad it's funâ€ co-op gaming.

I hope the dev gets some free time and actually takes a game that is 99.99% Unity / UnitZ and turns it into something.  If not, maybe (s)he should just give up game dev and move onto something else.

reviewText:
Long, Serious ReviewPrepare for some reading.

So! I got the game for 7p (GBP 0.07) on a 96% sale (original price of Â£2). In my opinion (TL;DR) is that this game isn't the best game in the market (heck, it's one of the worst) however it shows some potential, even if the whole concept, design and textures are just a Unity Asset Pack.

(Not TL;DR)
The first thing that I complained about was the poor framerate, even in the loading screen / menu (I even had higher frames in the actual game; 45-52FPS in the menu and 51-62FPS in the actual game) but that didn't stop me. After I had created my new Character (clevery named Ben Dover")
date: packed him in a suit and went in to the world of
hoursPlayed: this game.\n\nIn my first life I had experienced the terrible "Pistol" which had used all my clip in a single auto-fire burst; which dissapointed me (and my ears bled for a couple of miniutes)
voteText: and I'm not even going to mention the fact that the bullets don't even render or do any visable/physical damage (most of the time
helpfulPercent: 98% of the time) to the zombies. Later
votesHelpful: I went to my first house (on the way picking up 3 pieces of wood
votesTotal: all in one
votesFunny: convinient stack) and there I noticed a shadow. Not just any shadow
commentsCount: but my shadow
column16: or should I say the shadow of my "pistol"; a very shabby shadow at it's best (even if the game was in 1080p at it's "High" Graphical Setting
column17: which told me nothing about how the game is going to look). After that I got mowed down by jumping zombies; where I found out my pistol is completely useless (as mentioned before).\n\nOkay
column18: so I started my second life; in a position close to my old one. Here I was generously placed between 3 piles of wood; which I learnt was a mediocre melee weapon against the zombies. I saw a town
column19: so I went to the town; and found a gorgeous sniper rifle (one of the best things about this "game") along with some ammo. In that house I learnt about the crafting system and the building system; which allowed me to feel like an MLG by blocking all the zombies out after I had spliced two pieces of foundation together and put some walls on top of them. But my fun didn't end there; possibly the best thing about this game was the sniper rifle's kill ragdoll
column20: which made the zombies fly in rings as they are being ripped apart into shreds. Soon I discovered I could smash the zombies with pieces of wood through the walls - thinking this would last for all eternity; however the  walls did give up after some time and then I encoutered a big black thing
column23: I killed it in the same amout of hits as I did a regular zombie (but this "wolf" had higher dps) however soon the zombies caught up to me and
column24: I died.\n\nI would like to add that the game has no indication as to where you should find the resources needed to craft badages
column25: hammers (e.t.c.); since all I could find was wood
column26: shotguns and other weapons.\n\nMultiplayer works; to an extent (lower frames
column27: 1-5FPS less then Singleplayer has) but the players are often silent and idle (oh
column28: and the admin has super powers that can send you flying into the air and make your spine break; that was fun).\n\nAxes are only weapons
column29:
not actual tools that you can use to cut down trees and get wood that way. Grass is a flat 2D sprite that floats above the ground and looks misplaced.

Verdict:

CategoryScore (Out of 10)Performance7/10Graphics5.5/10Concept9/10* or 4/10Multiplayer7/10Gameplay6.5/10Overall6/10
*Note: 9/10 if the game were to be original and fully made by the developer
column30: but in it's current state it's a 4/10.\nVerdict: Buy it on sale
column31: and only if it's under 10p (GBP 0.10); and buy some for your friends too! It'll be a great laugh!"

reviewText: Wow. I was not ready for this game" (if I should even call it that). Despite the overwhelmingly negative reviews
date:
it was 2 cents so I said "What the hell? I'll give it a shot."

Pros:
-Steam Trading Cards so you can get your money back and then some.

Cons:
-Guns do not work in the slightest bit and for some reason are much weaker than melee weapons.
-There are far too many structures that have no physical presence in the world (i.e. you can clip through a lot of buildings).
-The most startling thing in the game are cars that will just suddenly roar into your eardrums
recommended:
promptly destroying them.
-The fact that this game even exists.

It's by far the spookiest game I have played this Halloween season. And not in a good way.

reviewText:
Apart from what you've undoubtedly seen everyone else write about this game, here are my problems:

- You move way too slowly.

- Your starting weapon's fire rate is... too high. You empty the 12-round clip in 2 milliseconds.

- It doesn't looks too pleasing for the eyes.

- No tutorial of any kind.

- Limited graphics options.

- Limited gameplay in general.

- No Aim Down Sights feature for weapons without scopes

- Not that you'd need it - guns don't do damage and empty their magazine extremely fast.

- Whacking a zombie with a torch kills them

- Zombies are too strong (take you down in the timeframe of 2 seconds)

The game is just generally... bad.

Not even worth the 9 cents I paid for this. Give me my trading cards back!

reviewText:
So, the first thing I noticed when trying to run the game on Linux was that the game did not load. I checked the terminal output and saw the following:

ERROR: ld.so: object '/home/user/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32/gameoverlayrenderer.so' from LD_PRELOAD cannot be preloaded (wrong ELF class: ELFCLASS32): ignored.
I disabled the Steam overlay and was greeted with another error when trying to run the game:

/bin/sh: /home/user/.local/share/Steam/SteamApps/common/Uncrowded/Fieldz.x86: No such file or directory
Upon checking the directory, I was able to verify that Fieldz.x86 didn't exist. There is a FieldZ.x86 - I guess the devs never got the memo that the path is case-sensitive. After correcting this, the game loaded with a 'Unity Personal Edition' splash screen. I knew this was probably just going to get worse now.

Anyways, on to the game. I look around and realize I probably need wood. There are trees everywhere and I already have an axe. I guess I need to chop down some trees, right? Nope. That would be logical, but it doesn't appear that this can be done. Instead, I need to find precut wood blocks strewn about along the road.

As I'm trying to manage my inventory, a zombie attacks. I equipped my gun, clicked to fire at the zombie... and the entire magazine unloaded at point blank range, but no bullets seemed to have hit the zombie. Zombie kills me. Eventually I figure out that the axe kills the zombies in a single hit, but I lose some health because the zombie touches me, or something. That's better than dying though, since my gun seems to be worthless.

Eventually I found a shelter. Zombies swarmed around me. I killed a few in the doorway, managed to kill a few more by swinging my axe through the wall, and eventually realized that they are spawning nearby. I sprinted away from the structure and eventually hit the edge of the world. The zombies didn't seem to follow me. I wandered back into a wooded area and walked away from my computer for a few minutes. When I returned, I saw my character is still alive. I wandered some more, found an old farmhouse, and was killed by a swarm of zombies, that seemed to spawn out of nowhere.

I wandered into another village and spotted a vehicle. I tried to get into the vehicle, but it tipped over for some unknown reason, and I died again. I decided at this point that I'd had enough.

This is a game that did not get off on the right foot with me, and did nothing to redeem itself. It's basically what would happen if Rust and Minecraft had a mentally challenged baby together. Don't buy it, not even for 19 cents when it's 90% off. If, for some reason, you do buy it... play until the card drops are done, sell the cards, and go do something else.

tl;dr
*The Linux version needs manual intervention from the user in order to run
*Despite an axe and an abundance of trees, wood is acquired by finding it laying around
*Guns are worthless
*Weird spawning mechanic
*Vehicles are death traps
*Don't buy it

reviewText:
Apart from what you've undoubtedly seen everyone else write about this game, here are my problems:

- You move way too slowly.

- Your starting weapon's fire rate is... too high. You empty the 12-round clip in 2 milliseconds.

- It doesn't looks too pleasing for the eyes.

- No tutorial of any kind.

- Limited graphics options.

- Limited gameplay in general.

- No Aim Down Sights feature for weapons without scopes

- Not that you'd need it - guns don't do damage and empty their magazine extremely fast.

- Whacking a zombie with a torch kills them

- Zombies are too strong (take you down in the timeframe of 2 seconds)

The game is just generally... bad.

Not even worth the 9 cents I paid for this. Give me my trading cards back!

reviewText:
Long, Serious ReviewPrepare for some reading.

So! I got the game for 7p (GBP 0.07) on a 96% sale (original price of Â£2). In my opinion (TL;DR) is that this game isn't the best game in the market (heck, it's one of the worst) however it shows some potential, even if the whole concept, design and textures are just a Unity Asset Pack.

(Not TL;DR)
The first thing that I complained about was the poor framerate, even in the loading screen / menu (I even had higher frames in the actual game; 45-52FPS in the menu and 51-62FPS in the actual game) but that didn't stop me. After I had created my new Character (clevery named Ben Dover")
date: packed him in a suit and went in to the world of
hoursPlayed: this game.\n\nIn my first life I had experienced the terrible "Pistol" which had used all my clip in a single auto-fire burst; which dissapointed me (and my ears bled for a couple of miniutes)
voteText: and I'm not even going to mention the fact that the bullets don't even render or do any visable/physical damage (most of the time
helpfulPercent: 98% of the time) to the zombies. Later
votesHelpful: I went to my first house (on the way picking up 3 pieces of wood
votesTotal: all in one
votesFunny: convinient stack) and there I noticed a shadow. Not just any shadow
commentsCount: but my shadow
column16: or should I say the shadow of my "pistol"; a very shabby shadow at it's best (even if the game was in 1080p at it's "High" Graphical Setting
column17: which told me nothing about how the game is going to look). After that I got mowed down by jumping zombies; where I found out my pistol is completely useless (as mentioned before).\n\nOkay
column18: so I started my second life; in a position close to my old one. Here I was generously placed between 3 piles of wood; which I learnt was a mediocre melee weapon against the zombies. I saw a town
column19: so I went to the town; and found a gorgeous sniper rifle (one of the best things about this "game") along with some ammo. In that house I learnt about the crafting system and the building system; which allowed me to feel like an MLG by blocking all the zombies out after I had spliced two pieces of foundation together and put some walls on top of them. But my fun didn't end there; possibly the best thing about this game was the sniper rifle's kill ragdoll
column20: which made the zombies fly in rings as they are being ripped apart into shreds. Soon I discovered I could smash the zombies with pieces of wood through the walls - thinking this would last for all eternity; however the  walls did give up after some time and then I encoutered a big black thing
column23: I killed it in the same amout of hits as I did a regular zombie (but this "wolf" had higher dps) however soon the zombies caught up to me and
column24: I died.\n\nI would like to add that the game has no indication as to where you should find the resources needed to craft badages
column25: hammers (e.t.c.); since all I could find was wood
column26: shotguns and other weapons.\n\nMultiplayer works; to an extent (lower frames
column27: 1-5FPS less then Singleplayer has) but the players are often silent and idle (oh
column28: and the admin has super powers that can send you flying into the air and make your spine break; that was fun).\n\nAxes are only weapons
column29:
not actual tools that you can use to cut down trees and get wood that way. Grass is a flat 2D sprite that floats above the ground and looks misplaced.

Verdict:

CategoryScore (Out of 10)Performance7/10Graphics5.5/10Concept9/10* or 4/10Multiplayer7/10Gameplay6.5/10Overall6/10
*Note: 9/10 if the game were to be original and fully made by the developer
column30: but in it's current state it's a 4/10.\nVerdict: Buy it on sale
column31: and only if it's under 10p (GBP 0.10); and buy some for your friends too! It'll be a great laugh!"

Almost all the game is unfinished/broken. And this is not an early access!

reviewText:
So. You are interested in buying Uncrowded. Don't do it. It's a waste of money and time. Reasons:
1st: Bad playability. The looking around feels weird, and the aim does not stop in place when you stop moving the mouse.
2nd: GLITCHEEEES. One of the most annoying glitches is that guns. Do. Not. Work. What kind of zombie survival game has this kind of glitch? Almost none, because firearms are a essencial part of these games, and this one does not have it. Also zombies are very glitchy as well. Also, you can't have more than one character, as the game will glitch and force you to play with the first character you made, and you can't delete your previous character, so yeah... choose your character wisely, because that's the only one you'll use.
3rd: Extremely uncompleted, almost nothing works asides from walking around and hitting zombies with a melee (the only way to kill them). Oh, and zombies do extreme levels of damage as well.
So, I expect that after reading this review, and the thousands of other negative reviews out there, that you realised this game is not worth your time or money and that you go back searching on Steam. Have a good day.

reviewText:
How Uncrowded was made:Step 1. Developers played Unturned
Step 2. Copy-pasted the whole Unturned and renamed to something that wouldn't be fishy (Uncrowded, seriously? They failed here).
Step 3. Changed Unturned's model from free to play to pay to play.
Step 4. Profit.

Guys, I mean really, this is the truth and you can't expect me to write a serious review for this knock off.

Verdict:  Do not buy. Cancerous game. Go play Unturned. It's free and it's better. I bought this copy-paste for 9 cents, farmed for cards and uninstalled.

reviewText:
OK so where to begin? Uncrowded (weird name but OK..) seems like a fun combination of Minecraft and DayZ... that is untill you start playing.

Like DayZ there is no goal or mission but to survive; scavenge, eat, drink and fend of incoming zombies but in this game you may also craft buildings if you wish. Graphically 'Uncrowded' looks a bit like Minecraft and personally I don't think it looks that bad but there's something seriously wrong with the shadows in this game.

The problems soon arise once the zombies start chasing you. Most of the time the zombies simply won't get hit even though the crosshair is aimed right at them. Maybe I'm doing something wrong but you would guess I know how to properly aim a gun in a game by now.
After a while some black zombies start chasing you who are ofcourse faster and stronger. When a zombie is attacking you, you can't kill it because it's too close and somehow you also lose all your ammo in one go while hearing an extremely loud noise (I tried to explain it the best way I can). The result: you will die and respawn again.

There are a lot of games like this and this is one of the worst. If the developers just put a little more effort in this game it could've been an OK game but as it stands now there's no fun to be had in this game unless you enjoy respawning and glitches.

reviewText: Probably one of the best games I've ever played. So good infact, it couldn't handle someone as low as me playing it, so it had to boot me out a couple times. The game offers expansive options and unvaried customizability, with 3 graphics settings and 5 different characters. Something I really like about this game is that unlike its more borish peers, it realizes the objective superiority of a plank of wood over something as trivial as a pistol or sniper rifle. While a piece of wood can take down zombies in 3 or 4 hits, you can unload multiple clips of bullets and not do even a lick of damage. I feel Uncrowded fairly represents wood in a medium where it is sorely misrepresented, and even mocked. Uncrowded's zombies are a standout, you can very well tell why zombies were able to take down humanity, not only are they stronger and faster than you, they also have an advanced space program! You read that right, while a zombie was chasing me, he realized his dreams and aspirations had changed, and he immediately took off into space after running into a tree. It was a truely inspiring and thought provoking moment you just don't see in modern gaming. In conclusiong, Uncrowded is a fantastic game, the game of the year, and possibly one of the best games of all time, surpassing even Battletoads.

reviewText:
You know...I'd understand if this game was 1.99$ and Unturned was 59.99$. Sometimes, we don't feel like spending a lot of money for a single game, and we play the cheaper, or F2P version of said game. For example (Yes, gonna use this example), when Minecraft was a PC exclusive title, lots of people that wanted to play minecraft on their 360 bought that â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ game with zombies, forgot the name, castleminer z? I think. It's either that, or nothing.

...But here...You actually have to pay for this game, while Unturned is completely free. Even if you had to pay 5 cents for this piece of crap, it's totally not worth it, because UNTURNED IS FREE. Paying for a vastly inferior product is something you shouldn't even think about doing. This isn't even hilariously bad, it's just plain bad. Now, let's talk about the game....

Basically, you pick your class (The only thing that Unturned doesn't have, but who cares?), and spawn in the middle of nowhere. You run around, a zombie shamelessly spawns right in front of you, and starts clobbering you. You try to shot said zombie, and your bullets seem to go through his body at times. (Btw, being a basic asset, zombies look terrible in this.)

When the zombie finally reaches you, your shots are worthless. You won't hit him, at all. You have to run, turn around, and shoot him again with your peashooter. Sounds like fun? It isn't.

Zombies are buggy, their bodies fly up in the air when you kill them, sounds are buggy, and quite painful to listen, graphics are ugly, boring, bland and uninspired (Because again, this is just an asset flip, barebones.), hell, sometimes they even flicker, as if the entire stability of the in-game world was about to collapse, and you can reach the end of the map". It's just an invisible wall. Didn't expect anything more. It's easy to get lost

reviewText: This game made me rethink morals in life. It made me reflect on my past, and overall find my purpose in life. A masterpiece to say the least, with life lessons that we can all learn from. It made me question reality. Is there reality? Or is everyone just a figure of my imagination. Uncrowded is better than a masterpiece. It is an art form that no game can truly ever come close to. The themes and motifs explored in this is awe inspiring. The photo-realistic graphics made me upgrade to 4 Titan's,  and even then i only achieved 30 fps at dynamic 140p resolution. The game is so graphically demnading, but it is worth the upgrade to get the most immersive, valuable experience that I will never forget. Bless you Uncrowded, for you have shown me the true meaning of life.

reviewText:
Prepare to kill zombies, and black zombies with a not so huge range of crude weaponry. Uncrowded is a wonderful reimagination of the Left 4 Dead series that is so much better than Unturned.
Graphics:
The block colours and dynamic shadows really redefine the FPS genre, and new hardwear optimisation means a peak of 61.5 frames per second. The minimal use of anti-aliasing really showcases the game's jagged edges and really makes the experience realistic.
Sound:
The detail of the sound effects make Uncrowded a hugely immersive gameworld, and make you feel like you are in a COD pub. The Shotgun loading sound really brings the nostalgia of the original Half Life games to heart!!
Community:
The cross platform multiplayer (Android, iOS, PC) is well supported, and was clearly a key part of developement. Some servers are a little laggy but, on the whole, cope with stress well.

Love this game, and have spent many minutes roaming its (almost) endless lands.

10/10

reviewText:
Look, I'm starting to get genuinely concerned with the amount of garbage being allowed onto the Store on Steam.
This game is bad.
Really, really bad.
You start of on a selection screen, and after choosing your character (and glitching out a ridiculous amount) you end up in on of the 3 worlds you can choose, and boy are they ugly.
The color scheme is way off, it feels unloved and not thought much of, and it gave me a genuinely sick feeling.
After you encounter your first zombie, you realise straight away that the hit register is so far off that its a major task just to take out one zombie.
The controls are all over the shot, E opens inventory AS WELL as crafting, and when you select an iten, the menu doesn't go away. You manually have to press E to get out of it, and become extremely tedious in tense situations.
And don't me started on those dark zombies. You simply cannot win against them, even when you sprint they are still too fast and you can't shoot them because of the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ controls.
It's a mess, fix it now!

Okay this is a serious review. And lets start it off:

This game looks more like a preview/demo of a game, rather then a full game.

1. It gives you no controls and it doesn't show you how to play, and it shows no settings either, so if the music is too loud or something, bad luck.

2. The car noises you can hear from ages away and they are so loud, louder then the whole game itself

3. The running is way to fast and unnatural and weird.

4. Ctrl shoots as well as mouse, like WTF? its okay if i cant crouch, but i hate if i try and it makes me shoot

5. You cannot exit a vechile. I tried to enter one, and somehow did but some random control, and i couldnt exit, i mashed my keyboard and pressed every button, still couldn't get out.

6. Black zombies are fast as f*ck.

7. How the f*ck do I get metal pieces? You either start with a gun, so u can defend urself (policeman) with nothing else and not too much ammo, or start with just an axe, so just wood, or just food. Like you should just start with an axe because wood is important and a gun or something to at least protect yourself.

8. A worse version of unturned, only way its better is the ground graphical features.

13. I played the game for less then 10 minutes and found all of these problems

reviewText:
This game is aweful. Do not by.

This game is a Unity asset flip, nothing more.

The programer can not bug fix to save their life, with weapons, that you would think would be easy to impliment, unable to function correctly. The weapons firing all the rounds in the magazine at once and dealing no damage, ragdoll physics that sends zombie bodies occasionally flying far off into space are just a few of the bugs that i found when playing this on stream, with many many others constantly visable. There is no ambient audio, however, if you do come across a sound source, like a tree or a car, they are very loud and obnoxious and will cut out a very specific distances.

The Zombies, the main focus of the game, spawn in very close to buildings. I believe that the game can only render about 2 or 3 zombies at a time, and there are two whole types of Zombie, the standard green, and a black zombie that can run really fast. They have essentally no pathfinding what so ever, walking only in a straight line, often trying to clip through walls.

Visuals are some of the poorest I have seen in a unity flip. The ground tile is tiny, flickers randomly at points of elevation changes, some tiles are missing textures, the trees are same-y and my god, the tiny-bricked homes! Textrue scaling is a thing!

I will admit that the one redeeming feature of this bugged mess. Hitting a Zombie with the axe. Thump!

Do NOT buy.

Feel free to watch the train wreak of a game" here.[www.twitch.tv]"

reviewText:
This, you would think, is a parody of Unturned.

Unfortunately for people who bought this game for full price, it's more of a parody of itself.

Pros: It goes on sale for next to nothing. I got it for $.02.
There's lots of wood piles to find. Just laying there. In the road.
There are also lots of shotguns (I found 4 in a room at once)

Cons: I have one of the best laptops in terms of gaming. On ultra high quality i crashed twice and capped at 15 fps.
I flinch every time I melee kill a zombie because the noise is so loud.
The reason I melee kill zombies is because the guns are garbage. You can only kill with headshots, and the bullets never register. I shot 3 zombies and they died 30 seconds later.
I have yet to find a single food item.
Zombies literally run faster than you unless you sprint. Which attracts more zombies.
Zombies also pop out of the ground to spawn. 5 feet in front of you.
The main Dev (if you can even call him that) apparently doesn't speak english well so the translations are pretty messed up. It's legible, but barely.
As far as I could tell, there were no towns, just random houses in the woods (again, with no food)
I couldn't find an options menu. Not sure if there is one.

TLDR: The dev is probably a 13 year old from a non english speaking country, and made this game as a school project. It's actual garbage. If you spent more than 2 pennies, you were robbed, my good sir.

reviewText:
This, you would think, is a parody of Unturned.

Unfortunately for people who bought this game for full price, it's more of a parody of itself.

Pros: It goes on sale for next to nothing. I got it for $.02.
There's lots of wood piles to find. Just laying there. In the road.
There are also lots of shotguns (I found 4 in a room at once)

Cons: I have one of the best laptops in terms of gaming. On ultra high quality i crashed twice and capped at 15 fps.
I flinch every time I melee kill a zombie because the noise is so loud.
The reason I melee kill zombies is because the guns are garbage. You can only kill with headshots, and the bullets never register. I shot 3 zombies and they died 30 seconds later.
I have yet to find a single food item.
Zombies literally run faster than you unless you sprint. Which attracts more zombies.
Zombies also pop out of the ground to spawn. 5 feet in front of you.
The main Dev (if you can even call him that) apparently doesn't speak english well so the translations are pretty messed up. It's legible, but barely.
As far as I could tell, there were no towns, just random houses in the woods (again, with no food)
I couldn't find an options menu. Not sure if there is one.

TLDR: The dev is probably a 13 year old from a non english speaking country, and made this game as a school project. It's actual garbage. If you spent more than 2 pennies, you were robbed, my good sir.

reviewText:
I was thinking about maybe making my reviews a little bit more in-depth but boy, did I pick wrong game to review next...
https://youtu.be/kewnHZCCdko
I wanted to record gameplay for this review. But when this clip was the only interesting enough to be shown to public we know there's something wrong with the game.

Uncrowded is an asset flip game. All the recources that were used in this game can be bought from the Unity asset store which is mainly used for personal fun, educational purposes or getting idea and tips on making your own game. Unfortunately there are no laws against altering thing or two from a pre-made asset and the releasing it as a full game.

In short, aviod this game. I'm depressed enough to even talk about the gamplay, if there even is a bit of it, and just straight tell you avoid this game like it's plague. Not worth your time, money or your good mood.

reviewText: I do not recommend this game if you're deciding to play two-player, as from what I've seen the timing between the two players is quite off. It has a lot of bugs in it and the enemies can spawn-kill you which is a massive annoyance to the newer players. I can see how it would get addictive and maybe you'd find fun in it then, but I still do not think it is worth playing unless you have 5 hours to spare to get yourself addicted.

reviewText:
I've only played 16 minutes of this game and that's enough to be able to sum this game up.

If you have 9 cents(sale price as of now and until September 7th.) buy this game, it's just another game in your library.

This god damn game, I swear, you SPAWN next to the strongest zombies(the black ones I believe) who are faster than you at full sprint, and they can take down all your hp in no time.

But now TSAR, don't you spawn with a gun, an axe, something?

Well yes, you can spawn with either of those, EXCEPT THEY DON'T WORK.

Seriously, the guns don't work, you shoot, and it doesn't hit them, it's like your firing blanks out of your gun at the zombies. I couldn't try the axe because my game just kept crashing when I started as farmer.

The cities and houses you can loot just constantly spawn zombies so you don't have time to loot them, and most of the time they have nothing in there.

The controls are okay, but I see so many people having troubles editing them.

And there's no advanced options for graphics(unity m8), so all I can do is select my res and texture, so no, you can't disable any graphic options that make your game worse(VSync, shadows, etc).

TL;DR Not even worth 9 cents.

reviewText:
This is going to be quite an honest review, I spent 2 pence on the game, and I clocked out at 63 minutes. Various others have paid similar prices (or more) and asked for a refund, I won't be doing such thing and in this review I'll explain why:

I base all my games on the premise that 1 hour for Â£1 is a reasonable cost. If I buy a AAA game for Â£30 I expect it to last me at least 30 hours, if it lasts only 15, I seriously question whether its been worth the money. Its a basic rule.

For 63 minutes of gameplay, most of it in the single player mode, I got approx 31 minutes per pence, that is nearly in comparison to another game on my list, The Last Remnant that lasted 72 hours in one playthrough (not 100% either!, in fact I didn't actually play it, I watched my ex-Wife play it) for Â£2, making it roughly 36 minutes a pence. But enough about the cost-playtime ratio:

The game is essentially based upon a content package that seems to be available for $50 for the unity engine, this is fair enough. What the developer has essentially done is renamed and released this content pack in a barebones release, currently on sale for about 79p or 2p in the sale. If the developer has made more than $50 in this game, They can call it a financial success. If I had paid full price for it, I'd still have technially matched my value criteria.

But what about the game itself, it plays more like a tech demo than a game, and in reality it could have changes done to it within a matter of hours and it could be so radically transformed and its value increased. I struggled to join a multiplayer game for a start, and when I did I never met another player (though it appeared some were logging in), there appears to be a quick inventory list but I have no idea how to actually asign things to it, crafting building material is fair enough but I don't get how to actually place it (I tried building a door in a pre existing house only to die before I could figure any of it out), and shooting is problematic and unreal. A plank of wood is more effective at the beginning until you get an axe, which appears to one hit kill zombies every time. There is a scoreboard by pressing tab, but otherwise no other notice of how well one does.

It appears as though the developer does make updates to the game, which is quite interesting; in the unlikely event that any of these suggestions would be considered, I make them anyway:

1) There is no good reason why personal scoring can't be labelled on the HUD, put it in a top corner.
2) Zombies clearly spawn near houses, its pretty much the only way to find them, the occassional one when you are hiding out in the woods would not be a bad thing.
3) There are two types of Zombies, this could be easily increased with ones that'll take more than a single axe hit, and make weapon progression more worthwhile.
4) In single player trying to find resources and building without getting jumped on is virtually impossible.
5) A round/wave based system would fix this game up so easily.

These basic things could improve the basic game so much and make it less ridiculed. Yes there are better games (for free) on steam using the same content packs, but I'm treating this game as an Individual game in its own right.

reviewText:
This game tries to mimic the success of Unturned, with a price tag. The Dev took everything that Unturned and Day-Z had, and tried to make a game out of it. Honestly, it looks like it was made in a few days. They probably thought that they could make money out of something free. If you really want your games to sell, at least work on them. And out comes this â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ game, Uncrowded, with the same prefix, gameplay style, and game icon. How the hell did this game get out of Greenlight? It's like the Dev ripped Day-Z out of cardboard, and they still sell it to people like me who buy cheap games. But, it doesn't even end there. The game is actually free to play on their website. So, what's the point of selling it for money on Steam?

The gun animations are a joke, barely any work done on them. Every item is held the same way, and all consumable items are given a 'punch' animation instead, which doesn't really make any sense. Damage done by weapons is unrealistic, as a .50cal sniper will destroy a vehicle in 5 hits, where a flashlight will destroy it in 4. The flashlight does the most damage out of all weapons in the game, either a bug or the Dev didn't really care much to compare the damage of weapons. There's really no use of vehicles, since sprinting is faster than driving, and that vehicles have so little health points that they will explode after a few shots. No warning, no smoke, just explosion.

Some weapons share the same fire sound, such as the M4A1 and the AK47. Why? Did the Dev run out of time that they had to release this game before creating another sound? The game has five classes, all uninspired, all vaguely described with their special abilities and bonuses. For example, the Salaryman class spawns with extra food, which doesn't really make sense. Another class, Nod New, spawns with Everything She Needs." What the actual â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ does that mean?

The game is very buggy

reviewText:
As a Master Duelist I could not pass up the opportunity to purchase this prime example of Indie gaming for $0.09. I was able to save the world in less than an hour while completing the game 100%.  I believe that others wish to achieve the overwhelming gratification that I have. Truly, this past hour has been the most fulfilling of the past sixty minutes.

Walkthrough (SPOILER ALERT):

1. Find an Axe. This will grant you INSANITY.
2. Die a few times, reclaiming your Axe from your corpse each time. Each time you die you will respawn with 10 more bandages. This will grant you IMMORTALITY.
3. Kill any Zombie stupid enough to attack you in one blow. Charge at them swinging. Swing early, then move into attack range. Master this technique to kill the Zombies without ever taking any damage. This will grant you INVINCIBILITY.
4. Collect every item you see on the ground. Locate the village. There is food and water here. Consume it. This will grant you INVENTORY.
5. Accumulate enough wood to construct a home with a fire and a ladder. This will grand you IMPENETRABILITY.
6. Using your fortress as a base, venture into the village for more supplies, food, and water. Slaughter zombies forever. This will grant you INFAMY.

Arrange the six legendary artifacts to create a pentagram. Congratulations! You have summoned ZALGO.

reviewText:
Okay, so the game's on sale 98% off the original price. Only paid $0.02 for the game, just to see what all the fuss is about, and to give my input on it.

So, here's how it all went down...
I bought game...
I installed game...
I tried...really hard...to play it...I really wanted to give it the benefit of the doubt...
...I was stupid for even trying...

So, with that said now, I will now make a quick list of the pros and cons of this so-called Game":

Pros:
1. Only cost me 2 cents...I let it sit on the title screen till I got 3 Trading Cards out of it. Currently selling the cards for 8 cents each. It's the only game of its kind where you actually make a PROFIT from the trading cards. But was it worth it? Probably not...
2. Thankfully the uninstall functionality works after obtaining the trading cards.

Cons:
1. Shooting your gun at the ground
hoursPlayed: or even at point-blank range at a zombie that's constantly bashes you does nothing but blows through the whole clip of ammo in less than a milisecond. Apparently using a log
voteText: or if you play as the Fireman
helpfulPercent: using the Axe
votesHelpful: or finding a Hammer and just using a melee weapon is far more efficient than any ranged weapon in the game.\n\n2. 3 Game Modes! Sandbox which...has absolutely nothing in it but stuff...that you don't know what to do with! Death Match which is unplayable! "Open World Survival" where the map is supposedly "Open World"
votesTotal: only to realize that when you reach the edge
votesFunny: there's an invisible wall on all corners of the map! As for survival
commentsCount: zombies or monsters will spawn sometimes directly in front of you
column16: they run just as fast as you
column17: and will hit you until you are dead cause you can't shoot them at point-blank range!\n\n3. There's a vehicle in the game! Sweet *Goes drives it
column18: only to see it spontaneously fly up in the air
column19: somehow land in between two buildings
column21: and there's no reverse* .......okay......I suppose that makes sense.\n\n4. No statistics
column24: no "game". How did this get passed Greenlight while so many other games with potential did not is beyond me...\n\n5. It's Halloween! Guess what they added to the game for Halloween!? PUMPKINS! Scarecrows
column26: and not a single thing done to even "attempt" to fix the game
column27: let alone change it from looking like a complete generic cut / paste copy of "other" games!\n\n6. According to my recorded time
column28: it took 3.4 hours to get the 3 Trading Cards. I busy playing Clicker Heroes while I had this going in the backround. Yea
column30: I'd rather play a mundane simplistic game like CLICKER HEROES over this pile of crap!\n\nAnd there you have it folks. Give this pile of dung a round of applause for making it up there along with other great titles
column33: etc. I'd rather play the game "Don't Move" over this!\n\nTo those that are Trading Card enthusiasts
column34: and are willing to suffer for 3 hours roughly getting Trading Cards to sell for profit
column35: get it while it's still on sale for $0.02.\n\nTo those that enjoy playing terribly horrible games
column36: buy this when and if it ever costs $50 just so you can say you blew a lot of money on a load of garbage.\n\nTo those that know someone you utterly dislike
column37: and want nothing more than to see them suffer
column38: but without wishing them any ill will (cause wishing bad things on other people is never a nice thing to do)
column39: buy and gift this game to them instead. It's far better than trying to come up with any clever insult upon those you despise. =)\n\nTo those that want an honest opinion on the game
column40: whether it's even worth spending $0.02 or even $0.99 to play
column41: please don't. There are far greater things in life that your hard earned cash can be spent on
column43: or a cheap roll of toilet paper.\n\nHope you all have found this review helpful in making the right decision. Thank you all

reviewText:
I've only played 16 minutes of this game and that's enough to be able to sum this game up.

If you have 9 cents(sale price as of now and until September 7th.) buy this game, it's just another game in your library.

This god damn game, I swear, you SPAWN next to the strongest zombies(the black ones I believe) who are faster than you at full sprint, and they can take down all your hp in no time.

But now TSAR, don't you spawn with a gun, an axe, something?

Well yes, you can spawn with either of those, EXCEPT THEY DON'T WORK.

Seriously, the guns don't work, you shoot, and it doesn't hit them, it's like your firing blanks out of your gun at the zombies. I couldn't try the axe because my game just kept crashing when I started as farmer.

The cities and houses you can loot just constantly spawn zombies so you don't have time to loot them, and most of the time they have nothing in there.

The controls are okay, but I see so many people having troubles editing them.

And there's no advanced options for graphics(unity m8), so all I can do is select my res and texture, so no, you can't disable any graphic options that make your game worse(VSync, shadows, etc).

TL;DR Not even worth 9 cents.

PS... Obligatory uninstall button worked better than the game""
